div1.p: Carter reports on the progress she and Brown have made and discuss some early Italian navigational references that they are still working on.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Frederick F. Russell, November 24, 1928
div1.opener:
Book
Misel (Report weekly)
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St., N. W.
Washington, D. C.
November 24, 1928.
Dear Doctor Russell:
div1.p:
Yesterday, my usual day for writing you re progress ont the book,
I wnent so early to the Library of Congress and got home so late that
there was no time for a letter at either end of the day.

Villalba's epidemiology has been very closely examined and I
am very thankful that we were able to complete our bibliographic cards
from his text. At present I am engaged in deciphering the text of one of
his original sources, a most unpleasant descriptiono of the scurvy in the
fleet of Vasco da Gama, after rounding the Cape of Good Hope in 1498. Its
by Ioao de Barros, in Portuguese (old Portuguese, of course), and I'm
very glad to have gotten “on its trail” through Villalba.

Miss Brown is spending the week-end with me and we hope, to-night,
to make up a list of some of our remaining unverified references to give
to some research workers at the Library of the S. G. and of Congress, who
have offered to try again to get the missing books for us. There are not
many of these unverified references, but, of course, I want them to be
as few as possible.

Next week we will return to some XVI Century Italian, which we
left to go to the Library of the S. G. last July. This, because the
Italian refs. were near the end of the MSS and the medical refs. would,
we knew, be needed earlier. This Italian, Ramusio's Navagationi etc.
contains some of our very important references, and I'm delighted that the
copy at the Library of Congress has recently been found. We were working last
summer with one gotten on an inter-library loan.

A letter from Dr. Frost, received this week, states that he will
will
-2-
probably need me in Baltimore, for some days' work, in the near future.
div1.closer:
With best wishes, I remain
Very truly yours, Laura A. Carter Dr. Frederick F. Russell,
Director,
International Health Division,
The Rockefeller Foundation,
61 Broadway, New York, N. Y.
